metadata.synopsis: A player opens up Shirra Clarwen's crypt with the Sentient Amulet in tow. This will make the Mad Monk inside the amulet possess Shirra's body.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Crypt"- Interact with S_WYR_SentientAmulet_Tomb_Lid_97f1280f-f052-4988-b59d-5f972c9651d6

20.speaker: Shirra Clarwen
20.text: Oh ho, honoured Shirra. Her spirit hath fled - and her body but merely a husk. Heh heh hee-hee-HEE!

24.speaker: Shirra Clarwen
24.text: Swear, I did, to shed this foul mania and bestow it upon Shirra! She was to endure, to suffer, as was her god Ilmater's wont!

3.speaker: Shirra Clarwen
3.text: Who, now, shall bear the madness Shar has wrought on me, so I might no longer suffer?

51.speaker: Player
51.text: If it will bring you peace, I will bear the madness.

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *Your muscles tingle and your mouth twitches as the laughing madness spreads through you.*
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Mad Monk's ghost leaps from the zombie into the player.

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *The madness tugs at your mind, prods in places best left untouched. You feel your wisdom begin to drain...*

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Call on your wits and shield your mind's most vulnerable reaches.

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *You remain wise as ever, even as Shar's madness spreads outward.*

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *You giggle, struck by the absurdity of the moment. A spirit hiding inside an amulet has brought you to the body of his granddaughter and possessed it. Outrageous! Ridiculous!*

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *Once again, you feel your wisdom draining away. Hilarious! Or is it?*

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Muster your senses, clear your mind. You will take the madness, but it will not take of you.

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *The urge to laugh dwindles, though you can't help but chuckle. You withstood the monk's madness and earned Tasha's Hideous Laughter.*

31.text: My friend - forgive me, for this mind was not mine own. May laughter be thy gift, never thy curse.
31.context: NodeContext: Serious for the first time. The monk has been cleansed of madness and can go to the god Lathander.

49.text: The Morninglord calls. Canst thou feel the warmth of his blessing? This is not my final twilight... but a new dawn.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Mad Monk's spirit laughs and vanishes into the sky.NodeContext: Dead serious. The monk has been cleansed of madness and can go to the god Lathander.

48.context: NodeContext: A wistful and trailing goodbye. The monk has been cleansed of madness and can go to the god Lathander.

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *The corpse is an empty husk once more. The monk, liberated from madness, is finally at peace.*
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: The corpse slumps over. The monk has been released.

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *Ha! You've earned Tasha's Hideous Laughter, and you're all the more foolish for it. Congratulations!*

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Hold firm. You will make this curse a gift. You will not surrender your wisdom.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Rally the tadpole, let it take the brunt of the damage.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Relax your mind. Let the madness siphon your wisdom.

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *A lopsided grin stretches your face as the madness saps your wisdom.*

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Steel yourself and guide the sensations elsewhere.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Call on the parasite to absorb the strike.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Call on the parasite to absorb the strike.

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Accept the inevitable. Allow your wisdom to drain.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Enough. I want no part of this!

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Gods, no. I don't want to inherit your curse.

23.speaker: Shirra Clarwen
23.text: Well if laugh I must, let our alliance end on a lark!

64.speaker: Player
64.text: And what happens if I say yes?

21.speaker: Shirra Clarwen
21.text: Thou shalt know the extent of Shar's mania. Tasha's Hideous Laughter, at thine beck and call.

34.speaker: Shirra Clarwen
34.text: But at what cost, who might say? Ho-ho-HO!

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Ponder what you know of the monk's affliction. What are the consequences of accepting it?

62.speaker: Narrator
62.text: *The monk himself holds your answer. Tasha's Hideous Laughter is a powerful skill - but earning it may come at the cost of wisdom.*

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *Try as you might, you can't intuit the price of bearing the monk's madness.*
